topic: Movie Workflow Series ("Tv series HIMYM explorative search")

goals.1: Identify the BGP for tv series
goals.2: Return the number of seasons and episodes per season of the tv series (the result set must be triples of season IRI, label and #episodes).
goals.3: Get the number of episodes in which the cast members played a role. Who are the most present actors? (the result set must be a list of triples actor/actress IRI, label and #episodes)
goals.4: Check who is the actor who acted in more films while working on "How I met your mother" (the result set must be a list of triples actor/actress IRI, label and #films).
goals.5: Compare HIMYM with the tv series "The Office (US)" in terms of number of seasons, episods and cast members (the result set must be two elements -one for each tv series- of tv series IRI, label, #seasons, #episodes and #cast members).
goals.6: Return how many of the actors who are members of the cast of the tv series have [Kavin Bacon number](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Six_Degrees_of_Kevin_Bacon#:~:text=Kevin%20Bacon%20himself%20has%20a,Bacon%20number%20is%20N%2B1.) equal to 2 (the result set must be a list of couples actor/actress IRI and label).
goals.7: Consider the actors who are members of the cast of HIMYM. Amongst the tv series which these actors acted return only those which received more than 2 awards (the result set must be triples of tv series IRI, label, #awards won).

name: 9214f28053

1.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?p ?name WHERE { wd:Q147235 ?p ?obj . ?p sc:name ?name. } LIMIT 20

1.narrative:
Previous query results don't look very promising
Intuitively, we want to see what "HIMYM" is instance of
1.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?type ?Tname WHERE { wd:Q147235 wdt:P31 ?type . ?type sc:name ?Tname. }
SELECT DISTINCT ?type ?Tname WHERE { wd:Q147235 wdt:P31 ?type . ?type sc:name ?Tname. }

2.narrative: Let's explore properties/objects related to HIMYM but filtering with the keywords episod and season
2.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?p ?Pname ?obj ?Oname WHERE { wd:Q147235 ?p ?obj . ?p sc:name ?Pname. ?obj sc:name ?Oname FILTER(REGEX(?Oname,"(episod|season)")) } LIMIT 30
output: list of How I Met Your Mother episodes
How I Met Your Mother, season 2
How I Met Your Mother, season 9
How I Met Your Mother, season 7
How I Met Your Mother, season 8
How I Met Your Mother, season 6
How I Met Your Mother, season 5
How I Met Your Mother, season 1
How I Met Your Mother, season 3
How I Met Your Mother, season 4

2.narrative: We have seen from previous query that the property hasPart links the Tv Serie and its seasons, let's see if it works the same for episodes
2.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?objTypeN ?obj ?Oname WHERE { wd:Q2715578 wdt:P527 ?obj . ?obj wdt:P31 ?objType. ?objType sc:name ?objTypeN. ?obj sc:name ?Oname } LIMIT 30

2.narrative: Episodes also use the hasPart property, we have all the information needed to build the query :
2.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?season ?seasonName (count(distinct ?episode) as ?count) WHERE { wd:Q147235 wdt:P527 ?season . ?season wdt:P527 ?episode . ?season sc:name ?seasonName. } GROUP BY ?season ?seasonName ORDER BY ?seasonName LIMIT 30
output: How I Met Your Mother, season 1
How I Met Your Mother, season 2
How I Met Your Mother, season 3
How I Met Your Mother, season 4
How I Met Your Mother, season 5
How I Met Your Mother, season 6
How I Met Your Mother, season 7
How I Met Your Mother, season 8
How I Met Your Mother, season 9

2.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?season ?seasonName (count(distinct ?episode) as ?count) WHERE { wd:Q147235 wdt:P527 ?season . ?season wdt:P527 ?episode . ?season sc:name ?seasonName. } GROUP BY ?season ?seasonName ORDER BY ?seasonName LIMIT 30
output: How I Met Your Mother, season 1
How I Met Your Mother, season 2
How I Met Your Mother, season 3
How I Met Your Mother, season 4
How I Met Your Mother, season 5
How I Met Your Mother, season 6
How I Met Your Mother, season 7
How I Met Your Mother, season 8
How I Met Your Mother, season 9

3.narrative:
Total of 208
We got from the very first query the bgp of cast member: [('p', 'http://www.wikidata.org/prop/direct/P161'), ('name', 'cast member')]
Let's see the castmember professions (URI given : wdt:P106) relted to acting
3.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?profession ?Pname WHERE { wd:Q147235 wdt:P161 ?castMember . ?castMember wdt:P106 ?profession. ?profession sc:name ?Pname. FILTER(REGEX(?Pname,"actor")) } LIMIT 50

3.narrative:
we take randomly Q1327587, an episode from a previous query
query example
3.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?p ?name WHERE { wd:Q1327587 ?p ?obj . ?p sc:name ?name. } LIMIT 20
output: original language of film or TV show

3.narrative: Let's see what an episode is instance of
3.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?epTypeName ?epType ?p ?pName WHERE { wd:Q1327587 wdt:P31 ?epType . ?epType ?p ?obj. ?epType sc:name ?epTypeName. ?p sc:name ?pName. } LIMIT 20

3.narrative: Let's explore tv series episode properties
3.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?p ?pName WHERE { ?ep wdt:P31 wd:Q21191270 . ?ep ?p ?obj. ?p sc:name ?pName. } LIMIT 20

3.narrative:
We have now the confirmation that tv series ep has also cast member
Tv series episode have the property cast member
We can now build the answer :
3.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?actor ?actorName (count(distinct ?episode) as ?count) WHERE { wd:Q147235 wdt:P161 ?actor; wdt:P527 ?season . ?season wdt:P527 ?episode . ?episode wdt:P161 ?actor. ?actor sc:name ?actorName. } GROUP BY ?actor ?actorName LIMIT 50

3.narrative: We add an order by to see the most present ones:
3.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?actor ?actorName (count(distinct ?episode) as ?count) WHERE { wd:Q147235 wdt:P161 ?actor; wdt:P527 ?season . ?season wdt:P527 ?episode . ?episode wdt:P161 ?actor. ?actor sc:name ?actorName. } GROUP BY ?actor ?actorName ORDER BY DESC (?count) LIMIT 20

SELECT DISTINCT ?actor ?actorName (count(distinct ?episode) as ?count) WHERE { wd:Q147235 wdt:P161 ?actor; wdt:P527 ?season . ?season wdt:P527 ?episode . ?episode wdt:P161 ?actor. ?actor sc:name ?actorName. } GROUP BY ?actor ?actorName ORDER BY DESC (?count) LIMIT 20

4.narrative:
We have a leading top5 (who supposedly are the main protagonists)
"While working on HIMYM" guides us to look for an "end of production date" of the tv show. We also need to find the bgp for films, let's start with it
To find bgp of film, let's take one actor/actress randomly and get the type of things where he/she was cast member
[('actor', 'http://www.wikidata.org/entity/Q200566'), ('actorName', 'Cobie Smulders'), ('count', '145')]
4.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?pieceType ?pieceTypeN WHERE { ?piece wdt:P161 wd:Q200566; wdt:P31 ?pieceType. ?pieceType sc:name ?pieceTypeN. } LIMIT 20

4.narrative: we have bgp of films and tv series here. Let's look for a "end of production"-like property
4.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?p ?pName WHERE { ?tvserie wdt:P31 wd:Q5398426; ?p ?obj. ?p sc:name ?pName. FILTER(REGEX(?pName,"(date|time|schedule)")) } LIMIT 20
SELECT DISTINCT ?p ?pName WHERE { ?tvserie wdt:P31 wd:Q21191270; ?p ?obj. ?p sc:name ?pName. FILTER(REGEX(?pName,"(date|time|schedule)")) } LIMIT 20

4.narrative: The "production date" property should be the most interesting for us based on the question
4.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?proddate WHERE { wd:Q147235 wdt:P527 ?season . ?season wdt:P527 ?episode . ?episode wdt:P31 wd:Q21191270; wdt:P161 ?actor; wdt:P2754 ?proddate } LIMIT 20

4.narrative: production date retrieves empty, we can use publication date as an alternative
4.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?publidate WHERE { wd:Q147235 wdt:P527 ?season . ?season wdt:P527 ?episode . ?episode wdt:P31 wd:Q21191270; wdt:P161 ?actor; wdt:P577 ?publidate } LIMIT 20

4.narrative: We will have to get the most recent publication date of episodes for each actor: let's try with a subquery
4.query: SELECT ?publidate WHERE { wd:Q147235 wdt:P527 ?season . ?season wdt:P527 ?episode . ?episode wdt:P31 wd:Q21191270; wdt:P161 ?actor; wdt:P577 ?publidate FILTER(?publidate=?maxdate && ?actor=?inneractor) { SELECT ?inneractor (MAX(?publidate2) as ?maxdate) WHERE { wd:Q147235 wdt:P527 ?season . ?season wdt:P527 ?episode . ?episode wdt:P31 wd:Q21191270; wdt:P161 ?inneractor; wdt:P577 ?publidate2 } GROUP BY (?inneractor) } } ORDER BY DESC (?publidate) LIMIT 20

4.narrative: We can now add the publication date of films where actor played :
4.query: SELECT ?actor ?actorName (count(?film) as ?countfilms) WHERE { wd:Q147235 wdt:P527 ?season . ?season wdt:P527 ?episode . ?episode wdt:P31 wd:Q21191270; wdt:P161 ?actor; wdt:P577 ?publidate FILTER(?publidate=?maxdate && ?actor=?inneractor) { SELECT ?inneractor (MAX(?publidate2) as ?maxdate) WHERE { wd:Q147235 wdt:P527 ?season . ?season wdt:P527 ?episode . ?episode wdt:P31 wd:Q21191270; wdt:P161 ?inneractor; wdt:P577 ?publidate2 } GROUP BY (?inneractor) } ?film wdt:P31 wd:Q11424; wdt:P161 ?actor; wdt:P577 ?publidatefilm. ?actor sc:name ?actorName. FILTER(?publidatefilm < ?publidate) } GROUP BY ?actor ?actorName ORDER BY DESC(?countfilms) LIMIT 20

4.narrative: Let's try with the property prod date instead of publi (for the films)
4.query: SELECT ?actor ?actorName (count(?film) as ?countfilms) WHERE { wd:Q147235 wdt:P527 ?season . ?season wdt:P527 ?episode . ?episode wdt:P31 wd:Q21191270; wdt:P161 ?actor; wdt:P577 ?publidate FILTER(?publidate=?maxdate && ?actor=?inneractor) { SELECT ?inneractor (MAX(?publidate2) as ?maxdate) WHERE { wd:Q147235 wdt:P527 ?season . ?season wdt:P527 ?episode . ?episode wdt:P31 wd:Q21191270; wdt:P161 ?inneractor; wdt:P577 ?publidate2 } GROUP BY (?inneractor) } ?film wdt:P31 wd:Q11424; wdt:P161 ?actor; wdt:P2754 ?publidatefilm. ?actor sc:name ?actorName. FILTER(?publidatefilm < ?publidate) } GROUP BY ?actor ?actorName ORDER BY DESC(?countfilms) LIMIT 20

4.narrative:
lack of prod date also for films, so we will keep the publi date for the answer
Final query
I use a subquery to get the latest date release of the episodes an actor played in, and filter with the release date of films he/she played in
4.query: SELECT ?actor ?actorName (count(?film) as ?countfilms) WHERE { wd:Q147235 wdt:P527 ?season . ?season wdt:P527 ?episode . ?episode wdt:P31 wd:Q21191270; wdt:P161 ?actor; wdt:P577 ?publidate FILTER(?publidate=?maxdate && ?actor=?inneractor) { SELECT ?inneractor (MAX(?publidate2) as ?maxdate) WHERE { wd:Q147235 wdt:P527 ?season . ?season wdt:P527 ?episode . ?episode wdt:P31 wd:Q21191270; wdt:P161 ?inneractor; wdt:P577 ?publidate2 } GROUP BY (?inneractor) } ?film wdt:P31 wd:Q11424; wdt:P161 ?actor; wdt:P577 ?publidatefilm. ?actor sc:name ?actorName. FILTER(?publidatefilm < ?publidate) } GROUP BY ?actor ?actorName ORDER BY DESC(?countfilms) LIMIT 30

5.narrative: For this task we will need the keyword VALUES. Let's just retun the two series iri and label (the office bgp is given)
5.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?series ?seriesName WHERE { VALUES ?series { wd:Q147235 wd:Q23831 }. ?series sc:name ?seriesName. } LIMIT 30

5.narrative: We now need to count the 3 asked variables for both series
5.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?series ?seriesName (count(distinct ?season) as ?seasonCount) (count(distinct ?episode) as ?episodeCount) (count(distinct ?castmember) as ?castmemberCount) WHERE { VALUES ?series {wd:Q147235 wd:Q23831} ?series wdt:P527 ?season ; wdt:P161 ?castmember . ?season wdt:P527 ?episode . ?series sc:name ?seriesName } LIMIT 30

SELECT DISTINCT ?series ?seriesName (count(distinct ?season) as ?seasonCount) (count(distinct ?episode) as ?episodeCount) (count(distinct ?castmember) as ?castmemberCount) WHERE { VALUES ?series {wd:Q147235 wd:Q23831} ?series wdt:P527 ?season ; wdt:P161 ?castmember . ?season wdt:P527 ?episode . ?series sc:name ?seriesName } LIMIT 30

6.narrative: According to the link, bacon number applies to actors, let's check if the property exists in wikidata :
6.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?p ?name WHERE { ?actor wdt:P31 wd:Q33999; ?p ?obj. ?p sc:name ?name. FILTER(REGEX(?name,"([Bb]acon|number|distance|degree)")) } LIMIT 20
SELECT DISTINCT ?obj ?Oname WHERE { ?actor wdt:P31 wd:Q33999; ?p ?obj. ?obj sc:name ?Oname. FILTER(REGEX(?Oname,"([Bb]acon|number|distance|degree)")) } LIMIT 20

6.narrative:
We did not find anything using regex on prop/obj related to actors.
Let's get directly Kevin Bacon's bgp as he supposedly should be related to bacon number
6.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?actor ?Actorname WHERE { ?piece wdt:P161 ?actor. ?actor sc:name ?Actorname. FILTER(REGEX(?Actorname,"([Kk]evin [Bb]acon)")) } LIMIT 20
SELECT DISTINCT ?p ?name WHERE { wd:Q3454165 ?p ?obj . ?p sc:name ?name. FILTER(REGEX(?name,"([Bb]acon|number|distance|degree)")) } LIMIT 80
SELECT DISTINCT ?obj ?name WHERE { wd:Q3454165 ?p ?obj . ?obj sc:name ?name. FILTER(REGEX(?name,"([Bb]acon|number|distance|degree)")) } LIMIT 20

6.narrative:
Let's try a different approach by exploring the given  "wdt:P4969	derivative work    predicate"
It is FROM (so maybe derivated from) kevin bacon, let's check it with regex
6.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?obj ?name WHERE { ?s wdt:P4969 ?obj . ?obj sc:name ?name. FILTER(REGEX(?name,"([Bb]acon|number|distance|degree)")) } LIMIT 20
output: Ysgol Gynradd Pencarnisiog, Pencarnisiog, Tŷ Croes, Anglesey, LL63 5RY : summary report for parents on the inspection under Section 28 of the Education Act 2005 : school number : 660/2160 : date of inspection : 16/06/2009

6.narrative:
We found the BGP for : [('obj', 'http://www.wikidata.org/entity/Q722700'), ('name', 'Erdős–Bacon number')]
Bacon number could be a subclass of it :
6.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?s ?name WHERE { ?s wdt:P279 wd:Q722700 . ?s sc:name ?name. } LIMIT 20

6.narrative: It's not, let's see then the related prop and obj
6.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?obj ?name WHERE { wd:Q722700 ?p ?obj . ?obj sc:name ?name. } LIMIT 20

6.narrative: We found the bgp of bacon number, let's find how it is related to people (actors)
6.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?p ?pname ?objType ?name WHERE { wd:Q25972335 ?p ?obj. ?obj wdt:P31 ?objType. ?objType sc:name ?name. ?p sc:name ?pname } LIMIT 20

6.narrative:
It looks like there is no Bacon Number individuals in the db, nor that this class is related to any human
we will change strategy and calculate it ourselves :
If an actor played in the same piece as Kevin Bacon, his bacon number is 1, as below :
6.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?actor ?actorName WHERE { ?piece wdt:P161 wd:Q3454165; wdt:P161 ?actor. ?actor sc:name ?actorName. } LIMIT 20

6.narrative:
Let's get now the actors with a bacon number of 2
If actor2 has a bacon number of 2, it means that :
We need to find an actor1 who played in a piece1 where Kevin Bacon also played
Then we find a piece2 different from piece 1 where actor1 and actor2 played but not Kevin Bacon (actor 1 and 2 being 2 different people)
6.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?actor2 ?actor2Name WHERE { ?piece1 wdt:P161 wd:Q3454165; wdt:P161 ?actor1. ?piece2 wdt:P161 ?actor1; wdt:P161 ?actor2. FILTER(?actor1 != wd:Q3454165 && ?actor2 != wd:Q3454165 && ?actor1!=?actor2 && ?piece1!=?piece2). ?actor2 sc:name ?actor2Name. } LIMIT 20

6.narrative: Checking if results are the same using multiple filters
6.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?actor2 ?actor2Name WHERE { ?piece1 wdt:P161 wd:Q3454165; wdt:P161 ?actor1. ?piece2 wdt:P161 ?actor1; wdt:P161 ?actor2. FILTER(?actor1 != wd:Q3454165). FILTER(?actor2 != wd:Q3454165). FILTER(?actor1 != ?actor2). FILTER(?piece1 != ?piece2). ?actor2 sc:name ?actor2Name. } LIMIT 20

6.narrative:
Final Query
If actor2 has a bacon number of 2, it means that :
We need to find an actor1 who played in a piece1 where Kevin Bacon also played
Then we find a piece2 where actor1 and actor2 played together but not Kevin Bacon
We need a filter making sure that: actor 1 and 2 are not Kevin Bacon nor the same person + Piece 1 and 2 are not the same.
6.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?actor2 ?actor2Name WHERE { ?piece1 wdt:P161 wd:Q3454165; wdt:P161 ?actor1. ?piece2 wdt:P161 ?actor1; wdt:P161 ?actor2. FILTER(?actor1 != wd:Q3454165 && ?actor2 != wd:Q3454165 && ?actor1 != ?actor2 && ?piece1 != ?piece2). ?actor2 sc:name ?actor2Name. } LIMIT 20

7.narrative: For this task, we have all the necessary bgps except the awards one. Let's see if it is related to tv series:
7.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?p ?pname WHERE { wd:Q5398426 ?p ?obj. ?p sc:name ?pname. FILTER(REGEX(?pname,"(award|reward|prize|decoration)")) } LIMIT 20
SELECT DISTINCT ?p ?pname ?obj ?Oname WHERE { wd:Q5398426 ?p ?obj. ?p sc:name ?pname. ?obj sc:name ?Oname. } LIMIT 20

7.narrative: Let's explore objects related to "properties for this type"
7.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?obj ?Oname WHERE { wd:Q5398426 wdt:P1963 ?obj. ?obj sc:name ?Oname. } LIMIT 20
output: original language of film or TV show

7.narrative: We see the award received property, let's try counting all the awards received by HIMYM
7.query: SELECT ?award ?awardName WHERE { wd:Q147235 wdt:P166 ?award. ?award sc:name ?awardName. } LIMIT 20
output: Critics' Choice Television Award for Best Supporting Actor in a Comedy Series
Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Single-Camera Picture Editing for a Comedy Series
International TV Audience Award for Best Comedy TV Series
Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Cinematography for a Multi-Camera Series
Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Art Direction for a Contemporary Program
Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Multi-Camera Picture Editing for a Comedy Series

7.narrative:
Consider the actors who are members of the cast of HIMYM.
Amongst the tv series which these actors acted return only those which received more than 2 awards (the result set must be triples of tv series IRI, label, awards won).
We can now try :
7.query: SELECT ?series ?seriesName (count(distinct ?award) as ?count) WHERE { wd:Q147235 wdt:P161 ?actorH. ?series wdt:P31 wd:Q5398426; wdt:P161 ?actorH; wdt:P166 ?award. ?series sc:name ?seriesName } GROUP BY ?series ?seriesName HAVING(count(distinct ?award)>2) ORDER BY DESC(?count) LIMIT 200

7.narrative: Same query as above but not using the distinct for awards :
7.query: SELECT ?series ?seriesName (count(?award) as ?count) WHERE { wd:Q147235 wdt:P161 ?actorH. ?series wdt:P31 wd:Q5398426; wdt:P161 ?actorH; wdt:P166 ?award. ?series sc:name ?seriesName } GROUP BY ?series ?seriesName HAVING(count(?award)>2) ORDER BY DESC(?count) LIMIT 200

SELECT ?series ?seriesName (count(distinct ?award) as ?count) WHERE { wd:Q147235 wdt:P161 ?actorH. ?series wdt:P31 wd:Q5398426; wdt:P161 ?actorH; wdt:P166 ?award. ?series sc:name ?seriesName } GROUP BY ?series ?seriesName HAVING(count(distinct ?award)>2) ORDER BY DESC(?count) LIMIT 200
